title: Camshaft and Bearing Cap Inspection

body.body: Inspect the camshaft sprockets for damaged and worn teeth. Replace as necessary.
Measure the camshaft journals with a micrometer. If any journal is outside the specified tolerance, replace the camshaft. For specifications refer to
Examine all camshaft and camshaft bearing caps for excessive wear and damage.
Wipe the exposed areas of both the camshaft journal and a single cap or cap area of the ladder.
Apply a thin smear of grease to the journal and a small quantity of silicone release agent to the cap.
Size a length of the Plastigauge to fit across the camshaft journal. Fit the Plastigauge to the camshaft journal using the grease to hold the strip in place.
Ensuring that the camshaft sprocket alignment marking is located as for removal, refit the camshaft cap ladder then evenly and progressively tighten the ladder bolts to
Release the bolts and remove the ladder. Using the gauge provided with the Plastigauge kit, measure the width of the now compressed Plastigauge.
The camshaft ladder is unique to each cylinder head and is, therefore, not available separately. If the camshaft ladder is worn or damaged, the complete cylinder head must be replaced.
Calculate the journal clearance using the Plastigauge chart supplied with the Plastigauge kit.
If the clearance measured is within the specified tolerance, remove the cap/ladder and clean off all traces of Plastigauge. Assemble the camshafts (see
Although Plastigauge is oil soluble, all traces of the material must be removed to prevent blockage of the oil drillings and resultant engine damage.
